intro: Commilobium polygaliflorum, commonly known as the broadleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
